content.en: Plant disease detection: Researchers have been exploring the use of hyperspectral imaging to detect various diseases and infections in plants. They have employed algorithms such as Extreme learning machine (ELM), Successive projections algorithm (SPA), Principal component analysis (PCA), K-nearest neighbor (KNN), and Support vector machine (SVM) to analyze the hyperspectral data and classify the presence and severity of diseases like blight, fungus infection, gray mold, powdery mildew, bacterial wilt, and more. These algorithms help in early detection and monitoring of plant diseases, providing valuable insights for farmers and enabling timely interventions to protect crops.
content.da: Plantesygdomsdetektion: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af hyperspektral billeddannelse til at opdage forskellige sygdomme og infektioner i planter. De har anvendt algoritmer som Extreme Learning Machine (ELM), Successive Projections Algorithm (SPA), Principal Component Analysis (PCA), K-nearest Neighbor (KNN) og Support Vector Machine (SVM) til at analysere de hyperspektrale data og klassificere tilstedeværelse og sværhedsgrad af sygdomme såsom skimmel, svampeinfektion, grå skimmel, meldug, bakterievisnesyge og mere. Disse algoritmer hjælper med tidlig detektion og overvågning af plantesygdomme, hvilket giver værdifuld indsigt for landmænd og muliggør rettidig indgriben for at beskytte afgrøder.
